flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=29>>29 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 29 years x 2 = <<29*2=58>>58 years old.
This means, Tully is 58 years - 3 years = <<58-3=55>>55 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 55 years - 1 year = 54 years old last year.
#### 54

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 29. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
